text: {{Infobox zone |name = Sagarmatha |native_name = सगरमाथा अञ्चल |settlement_type = Zone |motto = |image_skyline =Pangboche.JPG |imagesize = 300px |image_caption =Lower Pangboche village in Khumbu, Nepal |image_map = Sagarmatha districts.png |mapsize = 300px |map_caption = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = Nepal |subdivision_type1 = Region |subdivision_name1 = |seat_type = Capital |seat = |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_title = |established_date = |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = |population_as_of = |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_total = |population_density_km2 = |blank_name_sec1 = Main language(s) |blank_info_sec1 = |timezone = Nepal Time |utc_offset = +5:45 |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |website = |footnotes = }} Sagarmatha () was one of the fourteen zones in Nepal. It included mountain districts of the Himalayas (including Mount Everest) in the north, hill districts in the center, and valley districts of the Terai in the south. The total area of Sagarmatha Zone was 10,591 sq. km and the population of 2,054,326. It was bordered by China to the north, India to the south, the Koshi Zone to the east and the Janakpur Zone to the west. The main city of the Sagarmatha Zone was Rajbiraj which is also the headquarters. Sagarmatha was divided into six districts: District Type Headquarters Khotang Hill Diktel Okhaldhunga Hill Okhaldhunga Saptari Outer Terai Rajbiraj Siraha Outer Terai Siraha Solukhumbu Mountain Salleri Udayapur Inner Terai Triyuga == Related pages == * Development Regions of Nepal * Zones of Nepal * Districts of Nepal == References == == Other websites == Category:Zones of Nepal
title: Sagarmatha Zone
